item.title: Veeam RCE bug lets domain users hack backup servers, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Veeam has patched a critical remote code execution vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-23120 in its Backup & Replication software that impacts domain-joined installations. [...]

item.title: CISA tags NAKIVO backup flaw as actively exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their networks against attacks exploiting a high-severity vulnerability in NAKIVO's Backup & Replication software. [...]

item.title: VSCode extensions found downloading early-stage ransomware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious VSCode Marketplace extensions were found deploying in-development ransomware from a remote server, exposing critical gaps in Microsoft's review process. [...]

item.title: Critical Cisco Smart Licensing Utility flaws now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Attackers have started targeting Cisco Smart Licensing Utility (CSLU) instances unpatched against a vulnerability exposing a built-in backdoor admin account. [...]

item.title: RansomHub ransomware uses new Betruger ‘multi-function’ backdoor
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Security researchers have linked a new backdoor dubbed Betruger, deployed in several recent ransomware attacks, to an affiliate of the RansomHub operation. [...]

item.title: UK urges critical orgs to adopt quantum cryptography by 2035
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has published specific timelines on migrating to post-quantum cryptography (PQC), dictating that critical organizations should complete migration by 2035. [...]

item.title: WordPress security plugin WP Ghost vulnerable to remote code execution bug
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Popular WordPress security plugin WP Ghost is vulnerable to a critical severity flaw that could allow unauthenticated attackers to remotely execute code and hijack servers. [...]

item.title: GitHub Action supply chain attack exposed secrets in 218 repos
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The compromise of GitHub Action tj-actions/changed-files has impacted only a small percentage of the 23,000 projects using it, with it estimated that only 218 repositories exposed secrets due to the supply chain attack. [...]

item.title: Microsoft lifts Windows 11 upgrade block after Asphalt 8 crash fix
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has lifted an upgrade block that prevented Asphalt 8: Airborne players from upgrading their systems to Windows 11 24H2 due to compatibility issues. [...]

item.title: Is it time to retire 'one-off' pen tests for continuous testing?
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Outpost24
item.description: Annual pentests can leave security gaps that attackers can exploit for months. Learn more from Outpost24 about why continuous penetration testing (PTaaS) offers real-time detection, remediation, and stronger protection. [...]

item.title: HellCat hackers go on a worldwide Jira hacking spree
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Swiss global solutions provider Ascom has confirmed a cyberattack on its IT infrastructure as a hacker group known as Hellcat targets Jira servers worldwide using compromised credentials. [...]

item.title: Malware campaign 'DollyWay' breached 20,000 WordPress sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malware operation dubbed 'DollyWay' has been underway since 2016, compromising over 20,000 WordPress sites globally to redirect users to malicious sites. [...]

item.title: Kali Linux 2025.1a released with 1 new tool, annual theme refresh
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Kali Linux has released version 2025.1a, the first version of 2025, with one new tool, desktop changes, and a theme refresh. [...]
